intro: Argostemma stellatum, commonly known as the star-leaved siphonostemon, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. The flowers are often visited by insects, contributing to its role in pollination and ecological interactions.
